evidence.text: Defendants’ termination of Plaintiffs’ SEVIS records constitutes final agency action reviewable under the Administrative Procedure Act, 5 U.S.C. §§ 701–706.

extracted.value: Defendants terminated Plaintiffs’ SEVIS records, a final agency action reviewable under the Administrative Procedure Act, 5 U.S.C. §§ 701–706.

evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendants failed to provide individualized notice, failed to consider relevant facts, and based their actions on impermissible grounds, including visa revocation, which is not a lawful basis under 8 C.F.R. § 214.1(d).

extracted.value: Defendants failed to provide individualized notice and failed to consider relevant facts, basing their actions on impermissible grounds such as visa revocation, which is not a lawful basis under 8 C.F.R. § 214.1(d).

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 1. Declaring that the termination of SEVIS status for Plaintiffs and all similarly situated F-1 visa holders—who have not been convicted of any criminal offense, have maintained academic standing, and are otherwise in compliance with the terms of their visa—was unlawful, and that their SEVIS records, F-1 status, and visas shall be restored immediately;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declaring that the termination of SEVIS status for Plaintiffs and all similarly situated F-1 visa holders—who have not been convicted of any criminal offense, have maintained academic standing, and are otherwise in compliance with the terms of their visa—was unlawful, and that their SEVIS records, F-1 status, and visas shall be restored immediately;

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 2. Preliminarily and permanently enjoining Defendants Noem and Lyons from further SEVIS terminations without lawful process;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Preliminarily and permanently enjoining Defendants Noem and Lyons from further SEVIS terminations without lawful process;

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 3. Issuing a preliminary and permanent injunction requiring Defendant Rubio to withdraw the effective-in-the-future revocation of the F-1 visas for Plaintiffs Tao, Wu, and Li, and all similarly situated F-1 visa holders—whose visa revocations were part of mass SEVIS terminations in April 2025 and who have not been convicted of any criminal offense, have maintained academic standing, and are otherwise in compliance with the terms of their visa— and prohibiting Defendant Rubio from further revocations of those visas beyond the statutory authority of 8 U.S.C. § 1201(i).

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Issuing a preliminary and permanent injunction requiring Defendant Rubio to withdraw the effective-in-the-future revocation of the F-1 visas for Plaintiffs Tao, Wu, and Li, and all similarly situated F-1 visa holders—whose visa revocations were part of mass SEVIS terminations in April 2025 and who have not been convicted of any criminal offense, have maintained academic standing, and are otherwise in compliance with the terms of their visa— and prohibiting Defendant Rubio from further revocations of those visas beyond the statutory authority of 8 U.S.C. § 1201(i).

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 4. Awarding costs and attorneys’ fees pursuant to the Equal Access to Justice Act, 28 U.S.C. § 2412(b);

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Awarding costs and attorneys’ fees pursuant to the Equal Access to Justice Act, 28 U.S.C. § 2412(b);

evidence.source_document: First Amended Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 5. Granting such other and further relief as the Court deems just and proper.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Granting such other and further relief as the Court deems just and proper.
